biography

astronautical engineer

turned

web developer

I’m a graduate of the University of Southern California with a BS in Astronautical Engineering who loves coding and wanted a career with more learning opportunities than the space industry could offer.

Since delving into web development in early 2015, I’ve completed Udacity’s Front End Web Development online nanodegree and started at the Turing School for Software & Design. I'm scheduled to complete their Full Stack Web Development program focusing on Ruby on Rails and JavaScript by May 2016.

I currently live in Denver, CO.

  • Rails (4.x)
  • Ruby (2.x)
  • JavaScript (ES5)
  • HTML5
  • CSS3
  • SQL

Turing School: Freelancer

This group project took a previous project for an art marketplace and turned it into a job bidding site. Job listers can sign up to post jobs they want completed and contractors can sign up to bid on the jobs. I personallh implemented the bidding workflow, feedback workflow, and the layouts/styling (including mobile).

View Project Github Repo

Turing School: runHacker

This personal project uses OAuth 2.0 to connect to a user's MapMyFitness account. The application focuses on creating custom charts for user's to identify trends in their running. It utilizes the the following APIs: MapMyFitness, WeatherSource, Google Maps, Google Elevation, Google Timezone, and Google Geocoder. It also uses background workers set up with Redis/Sidekiq to import user data without making the user wait to be redirected to their dashboard.

View Project Github Repo

Udacity: Arcade Game

This project uses HTML5 Canvas and JavaScript to create an arcade game based on the classic Frogger. Udacity provided the art assets and the game engine. I coded the players, enemies, and other entities in JavaScript's object-oriented psuedo-classical style and added the unique objective to get specific objects to target spaces.

View Project Github Repo

Udacity: Brewery Map

This project was created entirely from scratch using KnockoutJS's Model-View-Controller architecture to dynamically display, search, and filter breweries I have been to in Denver, CO. It utilizes the Google Maps API & Yelp API to mark brewery locations and get Yelp ratings. Additionally, it uses jQuery's AJAX function to retrieve the ratings from Yelp asynchonously.

View Project Github Repo

Personal Project: SHA-1 Algorithm

This project implements the SHA-1 hashing algorithm as described in the Federal Information Processing Standards Publication: Secure Hash Standard using an object-oriented approach in pure ruby.

Github Repo
